description: Returns information about the specified broker.

parameters.name: BrokerId
parameters.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

nested_items.name: ActionsRequired
nested_items.description: Actions required for a broker.

nested_items.name: ActionRequiredCode
nested_items.description: The code you can use to find instructions on the action required to resolve your broker issue.

nested_items.name: ActionRequiredInfo
nested_items.description: Information about the action required to resolve your broker issue.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationStrategy
nested_items.description: The authentication strategy used to secure the broker. The default is SIMPLE.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Enables automatic upgrades to new patch versions for brokers as new versions are released and supported by Amazon MQ. Automatic upgrades occur during the scheduled maintenance window or after a manual broker reboot.

nested_items.name: BrokerArn
nested_items.description: The broker's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: BrokerId
nested_items.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

nested_items.name: BrokerInstances
nested_items.description: A list of information about allocated brokers.

nested_items.name: ConsoleURL
nested_items.description: The brokers web console URL.

nested_items.name: Endpoints
nested_items.description: The broker's wire-level protocol endpoints.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) attached to the broker. Does not apply to RabbitMQ brokers.

nested_items.name: BrokerName
nested_items.description: The broker's name. This value must be unique in your Amazon Web Services account account, 1-50 characters long, must contain only letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores, and must not contain white spaces, brackets, wildcard characters, or special characters.

nested_items.name: BrokerState
nested_items.description: The broker's status.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: The list of all revisions for the specified configuration.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: Required. The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the configuration.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The revision number of the configuration.

nested_items.name: History
nested_items.description: The history of configurations applied to the broker.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: Required. The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the configuration.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The revision number of the configuration.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: Required. The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the configuration.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The revision number of the configuration.

nested_items.name: Created
nested_items.description: The time when the broker was created.

nested_items.name: DeploymentMode
nested_items.description: The broker's deployment mode.

nested_items.name: EncryptionOptions
nested_items.description: Encryption options for the broker.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The customer master key (CMK) to use for the A KMS (KMS). This key is used to encrypt your data at rest. If not provided, Amazon MQ will use a default CMK to encrypt your data.

nested_items.name: UseAwsOwnedKey
nested_items.description: Enables the use of an Amazon Web Services owned CMK using KMS (KMS). Set to true by default, if no value is provided, for example, for RabbitMQ brokers.

nested_items.name: EngineType
nested_items.description: The type of broker engine. Currently, Amazon MQ supports ACTIVEMQ and RABBITMQ.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The broker engine version. For more information, see the ActiveMQ version management and the RabbitMQ version management sections in the Amazon MQ Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: HostInstanceType
nested_items.description: The broker's instance type.

nested_items.name: LdapServerMetadata
nested_items.description: The metadata of the LDAP server used to authenticate and authorize connections to the broker.

nested_items.name: Hosts
nested_items.description: Specifies the location of the LDAP server such as Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory. Optional failover server.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RoleBase
nested_items.description: The distinguished name of the node in the directory information tree (DIT) to search for roles or groups. For example, ou=group, ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: RoleName
nested_items.description: Specifies the LDAP attribute that identifies the group name attribute in the object returned from the group membership query.

nested_items.name: RoleSearchMatching
nested_items.description: The LDAP search filter used to find roles within the roleBase. The distinguished name of the user matched by userSearchMatching is substituted into the {0} placeholder in the search filter. The client's username is substituted into the {1} placeholder. For example, if you set this option to (member=uid={1})for the user janedoe, the search filter becomes (member=uid=janedoe) after string substitution. It matches all role entries that have a member attribute equal to uid=janedoe under the subtree selected by the roleBase.

nested_items.name: RoleSearchSubtree
nested_items.description: The directory search scope for the role. If set to true, scope is to search the entire subtree.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccountUsername
nested_items.description: Service account username. A service account is an account in your LDAP server that has access to initiate a connection. For example, cn=admin,dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserBase
nested_items.description: Select a particular subtree of the directory information tree (DIT) to search for user entries. The subtree is specified by a DN, which specifies the base node of the subtree. For example, by setting this option to ou=Users,ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com, the search for user entries is restricted to the subtree beneath ou=Users, ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserRoleName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the LDAP attribute for the user group membership.

nested_items.name: UserSearchMatching
nested_items.description: The LDAP search filter used to find users within the userBase. The client's username is substituted into the {0} placeholder in the search filter. For example, if this option is set to (uid={0}) and the received username is janedoe, the search filter becomes (uid=janedoe) after string substitution. It will result in matching an entry like uid=janedoe, ou=Users,ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserSearchSubtree
nested_items.description: The directory search scope for the user. If set to true, scope is to search the entire subtree.

nested_items.name: Audit
nested_items.description: Enables audit logging. Every user management action made using JMX or the ActiveMQ Web Console is logged.

nested_items.name: AuditLogGroup
nested_items.description: The location of the CloudWatch Logs log group where audit logs are sent.

nested_items.name: General
nested_items.description: Enables general logging.

nested_items.name: GeneralLogGroup
nested_items.description: The location of the CloudWatch Logs log group where general logs are sent.

nested_items.name: Audit
nested_items.description: Enables audit logging. Every user management action made using JMX or the ActiveMQ Web Console is logged.

nested_items.name: General
nested_items.description: Enables general logging.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceWindowStartTime
nested_items.description: The parameters that determine the WeeklyStartTime.

nested_items.name: DayOfWeek
nested_items.description: Required. The day of the week.

nested_items.name: TimeOfDay
nested_items.description: Required. The time, in 24-hour format.

nested_items.name: TimeZone
nested_items.description: The time zone, UTC by default, in either the Country/City format, or the UTC offset format.

nested_items.name: PendingAuthenticationStrategy
nested_items.description: The authentication strategy that will be applied when the broker is rebooted. The default is SIMPLE.

nested_items.name: PendingEngineVersion
nested_items.description: The broker engine version to upgrade to. For more information, see the ActiveMQ version management and the RabbitMQ version management sections in the Amazon MQ Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: PendingHostInstanceType
nested_items.description: The broker's host instance type to upgrade to. For a list of supported instance types, see Broker instance types.

nested_items.name: PendingLdapServerMetadata
nested_items.description: The metadata of the LDAP server that will be used to authenticate and authorize connections to the broker after it is rebooted.

nested_items.name: Hosts
nested_items.description: Specifies the location of the LDAP server such as Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory. Optional failover server.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RoleBase
nested_items.description: The distinguished name of the node in the directory information tree (DIT) to search for roles or groups. For example, ou=group, ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: RoleName
nested_items.description: Specifies the LDAP attribute that identifies the group name attribute in the object returned from the group membership query.

nested_items.name: RoleSearchMatching
nested_items.description: The LDAP search filter used to find roles within the roleBase. The distinguished name of the user matched by userSearchMatching is substituted into the {0} placeholder in the search filter. The client's username is substituted into the {1} placeholder. For example, if you set this option to (member=uid={1})for the user janedoe, the search filter becomes (member=uid=janedoe) after string substitution. It matches all role entries that have a member attribute equal to uid=janedoe under the subtree selected by the roleBase.

nested_items.name: RoleSearchSubtree
nested_items.description: The directory search scope for the role. If set to true, scope is to search the entire subtree.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccountUsername
nested_items.description: Service account username. A service account is an account in your LDAP server that has access to initiate a connection. For example, cn=admin,dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserBase
nested_items.description: Select a particular subtree of the directory information tree (DIT) to search for user entries. The subtree is specified by a DN, which specifies the base node of the subtree. For example, by setting this option to ou=Users,ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com, the search for user entries is restricted to the subtree beneath ou=Users, ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserRoleName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the LDAP attribute for the user group membership.

nested_items.name: UserSearchMatching
nested_items.description: The LDAP search filter used to find users within the userBase. The client's username is substituted into the {0} placeholder in the search filter. For example, if this option is set to (uid={0}) and the received username is janedoe, the search filter becomes (uid=janedoe) after string substitution. It will result in matching an entry like uid=janedoe, ou=Users,ou=corp, dc=corp, dc=example, dc=com.

nested_items.name: UserSearchSubtree
nested_items.description: The directory search scope for the user. If set to true, scope is to search the entire subtree.

nested_items.name: PendingSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The list of pending security groups to authorize connections to brokers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Enables connections from applications outside of the VPC that hosts the broker's subnets.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The list of rules (1 minimum, 125 maximum) that authorize connections to brokers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The broker's storage type.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The list of groups that define which subnets and IP ranges the broker can use from different Availability Zones.
(string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Users
nested_items.description: The list of all broker usernames for the specified broker.

nested_items.name: PendingChange
nested_items.description: The type of change pending for the broker user.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: Required. The username of the broker user. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 2-100 characters long.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationMetadata
nested_items.description: The replication details of the data replication-enabled broker. Only returned if dataReplicationMode is set to CRDR.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationCounterpart
nested_items.description: Describes the replica/primary broker. Only returned if this broker is currently set as a primary or replica in the broker's dataReplicationRole property.

nested_items.name: BrokerId
nested_items.description: Required. The unique broker id generated by Amazon MQ.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: Required. The region of the broker.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationRole
nested_items.description: Defines the role of this broker in a data replication pair. When a replica broker is promoted to primary, this role is interchanged.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationMode
nested_items.description: Describes whether this broker is a part of a data replication pair.

nested_items.name: PendingDataReplicationMetadata
nested_items.description: The pending replication details of the data replication-enabled broker. Only returned if pendingDataReplicationMode is set to CRDR.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationCounterpart
nested_items.description: Describes the replica/primary broker. Only returned if this broker is currently set as a primary or replica in the broker's dataReplicationRole property.

nested_items.name: BrokerId
nested_items.description: Required. The unique broker id generated by Amazon MQ.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: Required. The region of the broker.

nested_items.name: DataReplicationRole
nested_items.description: Defines the role of this broker in a data replication pair. When a replica broker is promoted to primary, this role is interchanged.

nested_items.name: PendingDataReplicationMode
nested_items.description: Describes whether this broker will be a part of a data replication pair after reboot.
